group_1.textLeft: We used to expect the best@from the people around us.
We thought that they would pity us,@and sympathize with our misfortune.
All we wanted was to be comforted by others,@even if it wouldn't solve anything.
Our shared fate of becoming Witches@was a torment upon our hearts...
But though all we sought was pity and comfort,
the only thing we received was@the wrath of those around us.

group_1.textRight: Because of us, the Magical Girls@of Yukuni were condemned,
and our worn-down comrades succumbed@day by day, their numbers dwindling.
We could feel a sense of looming crisis,
so to protect our innocent fellow Magical Girls@and prevent the spread of more Witches,
we drew all of the anger toward ourselves.

group_1.textLeft: As a result, I was shot with a hunting rifle@and covered in fresh wounds.

group_1.textRight: I was at a loss. A dreary love story from@my past threatened to be dredged up,
and I was forced to take on unreasonable@club responsibilities.
The people that I was close with suddenly changed,@and it frightened me.
I had one girl that supported me,@but I got my share of bullying as well.
And then the Professor showed up@and came to our aid.
...At that time I had already just about@given up on saving Magical Girls,
but my suspicions were still merely a hypothesis.
So, I decided to cling to hope once more@and tried to save those girls.

group_1.textLeft: I wasn't a Magical Girl yet at the time,
but I really owed the Magical Girls that saved my life,
so I did whatever I could to support them.

group_1.textRight: Thanks to the efforts of everyone working together,@faith in Magical Girls was restored.

group_1.textLeft: Given the current situation, I take it@that things didn't work out...?

group_1.textRight: ...Indeed.
While everyone strove to earn back that trust,@the six girls remaining were reduced to three.
Rabi, Asahi, and Sasha were all that were left,@as well as Urara who had yet to contract.
We all worked hard to make@peace with the students...

group_1.textLeft: In the end, we ultimately destroyed@everyone's spirits with our own hands.
earning ourselves even more resentment,@and forcing us to leave town.
Why was it that misfortune seemed@to dog our every step...?
It was as though someone or something@unseen was firing upon us...

group_1.textRight: Every time we felt that way, a sense of resignation@spread deeper into our hearts,
telling us that there's nothing we can do...

group_1.textLeft: So then, that's why you say that it's pointless@to tell the world about Magical Girls,
and that it ultimately will only lead@Magical Girls to despair...?

group_1.textRight: Yes...
